title: Last Chance To Take The Survey
summary:
Key ideas:
- The author used to struggle with structure in his writing.
- He found that using a clear, well-defined structure has greatly improved his writing.
- The author recommends creating a structure before starting to write and using headings to guide the writing process.
- The structure should be flexible enough to allow for changes as the writing progresses.

Key learnings:
- Using a clear structure can improve the quality of writing and make it easier to read.
- Flexibility is key when creating a structure for writing.
- Headings can help guide the writing process and make it easier for readers to follow.

Key questions:
- How can I create a flexible structure for my writing that is able to adapt as the writing progresses?
- How can I effectively use headings to guide my writing process?
- What are some common pitfalls to avoid when using structure in writing?
